content: Yes, Margaret Atwood's "The Year of the Flood" delves into political corruption. While the book is part of the "MaddAddam" trilogy and explores issues related to genetic engineering and environmentalism, it also looks at political corruption and corporate power. In the novel, a dangerous corporation known as CorpSeCorps has taken over the government and is using its power to manipulate the masses and further its own interests. The book's protagonists, a group of activists and survivors, must navigate this corrupt political landscape while attempting to survive in a harsh post-apocalyptic world.
